SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

net.cwroethel.swt.popupcalendar
Class PopupCalendar

java.lang.Object
  net.cwroethel.swt.popupcalendar.PopupCalendar

public class PopupCalendar
extends java.lang.Object

A date picker popup window. To use it is to first create the popup calendar:

...
 PopupCalendar popupCal = new PopupCalendar(shell, PopupCalendar.SHOWALL);
 ...
or explicitly providing a locale 
 PopupCalendar popupCal = new PopupCalendar(shell, PopupCalendar.SHOWALL,
                                            Locale.FRENCH);
 ...
The window itself is opened using the open() method e.g. with: 
 ...
 popupCal.open(shell, x, y);
 ...
to display the calendar, e.g. in response to a mouse click. The selected date can then be retrieved by calling
 ...
 Calendar selectedDate = popupCalendar.getDate();
 if (selectedDate != null) {
    ... do something
 }
 ...
The selectedDate has to be checked since it can be undefined (null) if no date has been selected.

PopupCalendar support SelectionListeners / SelectionEvents to nofify that a date has been selected. Note however that since PopupCalendar itself is not a widget, it can not be the official source of a SelectionEvent. PopupCalendar simply forwards SelectionEvents origining from the underlying DateChooser.

The PopupCalendar creates a new shell with the shell provided in the constructor as parent. If the PopupCalendar is not used anymore it should be disposed either by calling the dispose() method or by retrieving the shell with getShell() and calling dispose() on that.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Will Roethel, http://www.cwroethel.net

SHOWMONTH

public static final int SHOWMONTH
If set shows the current month in the selector. Used as style option for DateChooser.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SHOWTODAY

public static final int SHOWTODAY
If set displays the Today Button at the bottom of the calendar widget. Used as style option for DateChooser.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int SHOWALL
Show month selector and today button.

Method Detail

open

public void open(Control control,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Draw the popup window at origin x, y measured in the same reference frame as control (i.e. control's parent frame). If the popup window does not fully fit in the screen, attempts will be made to reposition it to make it fit.

Parameters:
control - Control
x - int
y - int

open

public void open(Control control,
                 int style)
Open the popup window relative to a given control. The popup window will be positioned below the control if it fits on the screen and above the control otherwise, and aligned either with the left edge (LEFT), right edge (RIGHT), or centered (CENTER) below or above the control.

Parameters:
control - Control
style - int

resetDates

public void resetDates()
Reset date displayed in the calendar to the current date and reset the selected date. Useful when re-using an existing instance of PopupCalendar.

public void resetSelectedDate()
reset the selected date. Useful when re-using an existing instance of PopupCalendar.

getDate

public java.util.Calendar getDate()
Returns the selected date. If no date has been selected and no Calendar instance has been registered with JPopupCalendar, getDate can return null.

Returns:
Calendar
